Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

HI Erik,

      Very glad to see your reply.Thank you very much.Now i  installed HERITRIX-1.12.1(heritrix-1.12.1.zip) on my windows machine without source files to try this out. when i add ContentTypeRegexpDecideRule after write processors  it is asking for regexp,so i gave "[^a-zA-Z0-9]+" and "REJECT".Even then it is downloading pages from japanese site.I tried giving "Accept-Language:en" as header,even that didnot work.By the way,I did not understand the special characters mentioned in your mail.Can u please explain in detail.

Erik Hetzner <erik.hetzner@...> wrote: At Mon, 28 Jan 2008 04:32:49 -0500,
"sajid khan"  wrote:
> 
> HI,
> 
>         I am using Heritrix-1.6.0.I want to crawl only english language
> websites.Right now my heritrix is crawling japanese,korean etc other
> language sites also.Is there any filter or settings that i could use to stop
> crawling otherlanguage websites(atleast in latest versions)?.
> Please help me regarding this problem.

Hi Sajid.

This would be very difficult. Web sites do not typically advertise
their language in a machine-readable form, so for most sites there is
nothing you can (realistically). Content-Language headers may contain
language information so you could create a modification of
org.archive.crawler.filter.ContentTypeRegExpFilter which filters on
Content-Language. But you would have to filter out Content-Language
headers that do not begin with ‘en’ only when the Content-Language
header exists, because most sites (especially English-language sites)
lack a Content-Language header.

By the way, Heritrix 1.6.0 is very old: it may or may not contain a
ContentTypeRegExpFilter (you will have to check).

best,
Erik Hetzner
;; Erik Hetzner, California Digital Library
;; gnupg key id: 1024D/01DB07E3
